intro: Frankenia hirsuta var. laevis, commonly known as the smooth frankenia, is a flowering plant native to arid and coastal regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and showy yellow-orange flowers. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its leaves are typically smooth and covered in fine, soft hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The species is valued for its drought tolerance and ability to stabilize soils in harsh environments.
